[blockly](./blockly.md) &gt; [IConnectionChecker](./blockly.iconnectionchecker_interface.md) &gt; [canConnectWithReason](./blockly.iconnectionchecker_interface.canconnectwithreason_1_methodsignature.md)

## IConnectionChecker.canConnectWithReason() method

Checks whether the current connection can connect with the target connection, and return an error code if there are problems.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
canConnectWithReason(a: Connection | null, b: Connection | null, isDragging: boolean, opt_distance?: number): number;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  a | [Connection](./blockly.connection_class.md) \| null | Connection to check compatibility with. |
|  b | [Connection](./blockly.connection_class.md) \| null | Connection to check compatibility with. |
|  isDragging | boolean | True if the connection is being made by dragging a block. |
|  opt\_distance | number | <i>(Optional)</i> The max allowable distance between the connections for drag checks. |

<b>Returns:</b>

number

Connection.CAN\_CONNECT if the connection is legal, an error code otherwise.
